issue_description:
# [BUG]: The lesson info dialog still appear  after navigation to the  profile page

### Describe the bug

When accessing the profiles of contributors within the lesson info dialog box, the dialog box remains visible on the screen even after navigating to their respective profiles.

### URL of the page where the issue is observed.

throughout every exploration

### Steps To Reproduce

1. log in to [www.oppiatestserver.org](http://www.oppiatestserver.org/)
2. Go to Learn- Fractions- What is a fraction
3. Click on the `Lesson info i` to the left bottom end
4. visit to any of the contributor's profile
Notice the dialog box will persist in front of a screen


### Expected Behavior


The expected behaviour for this issue is that the dialog box should disappear from the screen once users navigate to the profiles of contributors during exploration.

### Screenshots/Videos


https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/108923011/c50e3c2c-d757-4a2d-8a2d-568b353f515d



### What device are you using?

Desktop

### Operating System

MacOS

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

_No response_

### Browser version

_No response_

### Additional context

#16976 is worth looking at. ( Note: it is a different issue but might be a better option to solve it together )

### Tips for developers

Before addressing the bug, please identify which PR caused the issue (you can follow the steps [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/How-to-find-the-commit-which-introduced-a-bug)). If you identify the PR, comment on the issue with a link to it. If not, mention the commit hash of the oldest commit you saw the bug on (and the month and year it was made in).

Also, if this is your first issue, please make sure to follow https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue and https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#setting-things-up before claiming it. Thanks!

@hrshkshri Can you assign me this issue ? I added a closeModal method at lesson-information-card-modal.component  in the file core/templates/pages/exploration-player-page/templates/lesson-information-card-modal.component.ts
![closeModal](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/98162702/91d8d6d2-bddd-4169-bc40-423f4a3f6b69)
I added an onclick handler to the contributors list component in the modal at file core/templates/pages/exploration-player-page/templates/lesson-information-card-modal.component.html
![s2](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/98162702/80967d7c-e2df-452d-993a-92d7080d5b75)

> @hrshkshri Can you assign me this issue ? I added a closeModal method at lesson-information-card-modal.component in the file core/templates/pages/exploration-player-page/templates/lesson-information-card-modal.component.ts ![closeModal](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/98162702/314161599-91d8d6d2-bddd-4169-bc40-423f4a3f6b69.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..FdaISxYF0l-tdiqqPJePfJYUvE6TjsgiQUF-ZrgdH48) I added an onclick handler to the contributors list component in the modal at file core/templates/pages/exploration-player-page/templates/lesson-information-card-modal.component.html ![s2](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/98162702/314162107-80967d7c-e2df-452d-993a-92d7080d5b75.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..EYmkX47BFRa_DVldrdfy9-Q70vbNz3rpYW_NfGxlstM)

Hmm, Can you run it locally and share us a demo video, we can assign it to you once `triage needed` is removed

Sure @hrshkshri , here is the demo video, 

https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/98162702/3b115359-c519-4a30-9a84-c2bafc2840ea

> Sure @hrshkshri , here is the demo video,
> 
>  isssue.demo.mp4

@Pratyush-Dehury 
Wait unitl `triage needed` is removed.

I've triaged this -- the approach looks reasonable, @Pratyush-Dehury, thanks.

I've assigned you, when can you make a PR?
Thanks @seanlip , I will make a PR in 2 to 3 days.
Update: @Pratyush-Dehury is not able to work on this due to exams. This issue is open for other contributors.
I am working on a solution for this issue, I will post a description for the PR once I have found the fix.

Hi @hrshkshri! I have a working solution for this issue. I have added the cancel() method, which closes the model(also called when the X button is pressed) to the HTML for the contributors div in core/templates/pages/exploration-player-page/templates/lesson-information-card-modal.component.html I have attached a picture of the code changes and a video of the fix working. I am able to make a PR whenever. https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/18372009/dc5ce8b5-83dd-439a-b61d-ef273ce7adba

> Hi @hrshkshri! I have a working solution for this issue. I have added the cancel() method, which closes the model(also called when the X button is pressed) to the HTML for the contributors div in core/templates/pages/exploration-player-page/templates/lesson-information-card-modal.component.html I have attached a picture of the code changes and a video of the fix working. I am able to make a PR whenever. > > Screen.Recording.2024-04-24.at.11.15.34.PM.mov > Looks reasonable to me Assigning @cwasserman1 (Maybe rename cancel() -- be more specific like closeModel or something like that)
@hrshkshri The method cancel() that I'm using is used elsewhere in the HTML to close the modal. For consistency, should I just use that method instead of making a new one?

> @hrshkshri The method cancel() that I'm using is used elsewhere in the HTML to close the modal. For consistency, should I just use that method instead of making a new one?

Ok @cwasserman1, Sounds good to me. /cc @seanlip
Closing this issue as completed in https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/20222.

questions_generated: What is the primary cause of the lesson info dialog persisting after navigating to a contributor's profile in the oppia_oppia repository?
How can the issue of the lesson info dialog persisting be resolved within the lesson-information-card-modal.component.ts file?
What HTML element or feature in lesson-information-card-modal.component.html could be modified to ensure the dialog closes when a contributor's profile is clicked?
Why might it be beneficial to address issues #16976 and the lesson info dialog persistence together, as mentioned in the additional context?
What preliminary steps should a developer take before attempting to fix this bug, according to the tips provided?
golden_answers_generated: The primary cause is likely that the lesson info dialog box does not have a mechanism to close itself or get dismissed when a navigation event occurs, such as when clicking on a contributor's profile. This indicates a lack of event handling for navigation within the dialog component.

To resolve the issue, a method like closeModal can be implemented within the lesson-information-card-modal.component.ts file. This method would ensure that the dialog is closed when a navigation event is triggered, such as when a user clicks on a contributor's profile.

An onclick event handler can be added to the relevant HTML element that represents the contributors' list in the lesson-information-card-modal.component.html file. This event handler would call the closeModal method to close the dialog when a contributor's profile is clicked.

Addressing both issues together might be beneficial because they could potentially be related, sharing similar underlying causes or requiring similar solutions. Investigating both issues concurrently could lead to a more comprehensive understanding of the navigation and dialog handling within the application, allowing for a more efficient and holistic fix.

Before fixing the bug, a developer should identify which pull request caused the issue by following the steps outlined in the Oppia wiki. They should comment on the issue with a link to the PR or mention the commit hash of the oldest commit where the bug was observed. Additionally, if it's their first issue, they should follow the guidelines in the Oppia wiki for contributing code and setting up the development environment.
